title: What is Artificial Intelligence (AI)?
description: AI refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are programmed to think, learn, and make decisions. It encompasses technologies like machine learning, natural language processing, and robotics.

title: How does Machine Learning relate to AI?
description: Machine Learning is a subset of AI that allows systems to learn from data and improve their performance over time without being explicitly programmed.

title: What are the types of AI?
description: AI is typically categorized into three types: Narrow AI (task-specific), General AI (human-level intelligence), and Superintelligent AI (surpassing human intelligence).

title: Where is AI used in real life?
description: AI is used in many industries, including healthcare (diagnostics), finance (fraud detection), transportation (autonomous vehicles), retail (recommendation engines), and more.

title: Is AI safe?
description: AI can be safe if developed and monitored responsibly. However, there are concerns about misuse, bias, and lack of transparency that require ethical and regulatory frameworks.

title: Can AI replace human jobs?
description: AI can automate certain tasks, leading to job shifts rather than outright replacement. It often augments human capabilities, but some routine jobs may become obsolete.

title: What programming languages are used in AI?
description: Common languages for AI development include Python, R, Java, Julia, and C++. Python is the most widely used due to its extensive libraries and community support.

title: What is deep learning?
description: Deep learning is a subset of machine learning that uses neural networks with multiple layers to analyze complex patterns in large amounts of data.

title: What is the difference between AI and automation?
description: Automation involves predefined rules for tasks, while AI enables machines to learn and make decisions. AI can power smarter, more adaptive automation systems.

title: How can I start learning AI?
description: Start with Python programming, then explore online courses in machine learning, data science, and neural networks. Platforms like Coursera, edX, and Khan Academy are great for beginners.
